intro: Scrophularia marilandica, commonly known as Maryland tea, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its hairy, square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, woodland habitats and is often found in shaded areas along stream banks. Maryland tea is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
